body:
```
$ git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/spack/spack.git

Cloning into 'spack'...
remote: Enumerating objects: 7553, done.
remote: Counting objects: 100% (7553/7553), done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (3961/3961), done.
remote: Total 7553 (delta 730), reused 4489 (delta 623), pack-reused 0
Receiving objects: 100% (7553/7553), 4.13 MiB | 7.28 MiB/s, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (730/730), done.
Checking out files: 100% (4351/4351), done.
warning: the following paths have collided (e.g. case-sensitive paths
on a case-insensitive filesystem) and only one from the same
colliding group is in the working tree:

  'lib/spack/env/cray/CC'
  'lib/spack/env/cray/cc'
  'lib/spack/env/craype/CC'
  'lib/spack/env/craype/cc'
```

It doesn't matter whether I do --depth 1 or not, it barfs like that. I'm on 10.13.6.  My HD is `APFS (encrypted)`
title: Mac clone problem
